Stereonet (poles)

Source: R/stereo_pole.R
stereo_pole.Rd

Draws the poles to planes (great circles) on an equal area stereonet.

stereo_pole(dir, dip, points.col = "blue", points.shape = 3, add = FALSE)

Arguments

dir

A vector of dip directions in degrees
dip

A vector of dip angles in degrees
points.col

Color for the poles
points.shape

Shape value (pch) for the poles
add

A logical indicating to add or not the poles to an existing plot

Value

A stereonet plot

Details

This can be added to a stereonet from stereo_plane()

Examples

dip.dir <- runif(min = 120, max = 170, n = 20)
dip <- runif(min = 10, max = 60, n = 20)
stereo_pole(dip.dir, dip)
#> $x
#>  [1] -0.06014288 -0.26569379 -0.26780282 -0.10154703 -0.16294549 -0.22707333
#>  [7] -0.24157755 -0.37186547 -0.31360531 -0.36233084 -0.39838070 -0.17674788
#> [13] -0.22505506 -0.37762762 -0.14612076 -0.20531451 -0.05872750 -0.58631224
#> [19] -0.15030906 -0.25825773
#> 
#> $y
#>  [1] 0.1387858 0.1583270 0.2138819 0.2159213 0.2946087 0.3495594 0.4099490
#>  [8] 0.4909585 0.2435973 0.5142813 0.4485323 0.2250601 0.3479944 0.5418281
#> [15] 0.2724575 0.6444430 0.1835226 0.3617237 0.6853096 0.3925468
#> 
stereo_plane(dip.dir, dip, dir = "dip")
stereo_pole(dip.dir, dip, add = TRUE)
#> $x
#>  [1] -0.06014288 -0.26569379 -0.26780282 -0.10154703 -0.16294549 -0.22707333
#>  [7] -0.24157755 -0.37186547 -0.31360531 -0.36233084 -0.39838070 -0.17674788
#> [13] -0.22505506 -0.37762762 -0.14612076 -0.20531451 -0.05872750 -0.58631224
#> [19] -0.15030906 -0.25825773
#> 
#> $y
#>  [1] 0.1387858 0.1583270 0.2138819 0.2159213 0.2946087 0.3495594 0.4099490
#>  [8] 0.4909585 0.2435973 0.5142813 0.4485323 0.2250601 0.3479944 0.5418281
#> [15] 0.2724575 0.6444430 0.1835226 0.3617237 0.6853096 0.3925468
#>
